dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 545 IH: Defending Domestic Produce Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Buchanan (for himself and Mr. Soto) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title VII of the Tariff Act of 1930 to provide for the treatment of core seasonal industries affected by antidumping or countervailing duty investigations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defending Domestic Produce Protection Act .

subsection.text: Section 771 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1677) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term core seasonal industry means the producers—

subparagraph.text: of a domestic like product that is a raw agricultural product,

whose collective output of the domestic like product constitutes a majority of the total production of the domestic like product in any State or group of States that accounts for a major portion of the total production of the domestic like product during any discrete season or cyclical period of time that concludes not later than 8 weeks after the date in which the product is harvested, and
that make substantially all of their sales of the domestic like product during the season or cyclical period of time described in subparagraph (B).

subsection.text: Section 771(4)(A) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1677(4)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking industry means the producers and inserting the following: “‘industry’ means—
by striking the end period and inserting , or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Section 771(9)(E) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1677(9)(E)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking association a majority and inserting the following: “association—

clause.text: except as provided in clause (ii), a majority

paragraph.text: by inserting or after States,; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: in the case of a proceeding under this title involving a core seasonal industry, whose members constitute not less than 80 percent of the core seasonal industry,

section.header: Improvements to countervailing duty procedures for core seasonal industries

subsection.text: Section 702(c)(4) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1671a(c)(4)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subclauses (I) and (II), and by moving such subclauses, as so redesignated, 2 ems to the right;
in the matter preceding subclause (I), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), by striking behalf of the industry, if— and inserting the following: “behalf of—

clause.text: an industry (other than a core seasonal industry), if—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (II), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), by striking the period at the end and inserting , or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: a core seasonal industry, if the domestic producers or workers who support the petition account for at least 50 percent of the total production of the domestic like product in any State or group of States that accounts for at least 50 percent of total production of the domestic like product during the season or cyclical period of time specified in the petition, determined by averaging production over the 3 seasons or cyclical periods of time preceding the filing of the petition.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by inserting (during the season or cyclical period of time specified in the petition, if applicable) after their interests as domestic producers; and
in subparagraph (D), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking support and all that follows through domestic like product and inserting industry support in accordance with subparagraph (A).

subsection.header: Suspension of investigations for extraordinary circumstances
subsection.text: Section 704(c)(4)(A)(i) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1671c(c)(4)(A)(i)) is amended by inserting (as defined in section 771(4)(A)(i)) after domestic industry.
Section 705(c)(1) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1671d(c)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking , and and inserting a comma; and
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:

subparagraph.text: in cases involving a countervailable subsidy that affects a core seasonal industry solely during a specific season or cyclical period of time, the administering authority shall limit the application of any rate determined under subparagraph (B) to that season or cyclical period of time, and

section.header: Improvements to antidumping duty procedures for core seasonal industries

subsection.text: Section 732(c)(4) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1673a(c)(4)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subclauses (I) and (II), and by moving such subclauses, as so redesignated, 2 ems to the right;
in the matter preceding subclause (I), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), by striking behalf of the industry, if— and inserting the following: “behalf of—

clause.text: an industry (other than a core seasonal industry), if—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (II), as redesignated by subparagraph (A), by striking the period at the end and inserting , or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: a core seasonal industry, if the domestic producers or workers who support the petition account for at least 50 percent of the total production of the domestic like product in any State or group of States that accounts for at least 50 percent of total production of the domestic like product during the season or cyclical period of time specified in the petition, determined by averaging production over the 3 seasons or cyclical periods of time preceding the filing of the petition.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by inserting (during the season or cyclical period of time specified in the petition, if applicable) after their interests as domestic producers; and
in subparagraph (D), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking support and all that follows through domestic like product and inserting industry support in accordance with subparagraph (A).

subsection.header: Suspension of investigations for extraordinary circumstances
subsection.text: Section 734(c)(2)(A)(i) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1673c(c)(2)(A)(i)) is amended by inserting (as defined in section 771(4)(A)(i)) after domestic industry.
Section 735(c)(1) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1673d(c)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking , and and inserting a comma; and
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:

subparagraph.text: in cases involving dumping that affects a core seasonal industry solely during a specific season or cyclical period of time, the administering authority shall limit the application of any rate determined under subparagraph (B) to that season or cyclical period of time, and

section.text: Pursuant to section 418 of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act (19 U.S.C. 4588), the amendments made by this Act apply with respect to goods from Canada and Mexico.
